conclusion: Analyze forces acting on suitcase to find values of μ and θ.
Gravitational force G is calculated as G = mg = 150 N.
Normal force N is the supporting force exerted by the ground.
Pulling force F is 90 N at angle θ above horizontal.
Frictional force f is proportional to normal force, f = μN.
Pulling force F resolved into components: F_x = F cos θ, F_y = F sin θ.
Net vertical force is zero: N + F_y = G, leading to N = 150 - 90 sin θ.
Net horizontal force is zero: F_x = f, leading to 90 cos θ = μN.
Substitute N = 150 - 90 sin θ into horizontal force equation.
Two equations: N = 150 - 90 sin θ and 90 cos θ = μ(150 - 90 sin θ).
Calculate cos θ using identity: cos 37° = 0.8.
Calculate μ: 72 = μ × 96, leading to μ = 0.75.
